Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: pretty sure Pirate will be second!

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: since the entire Hush blockchain is 330MB currently, not downloading a 900MB file we don't need is quite strategic!

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: @dukeleto when you build the hush daemon is built, how will pirate chain be able to build komodo without downloading the sprout keys.   is there a build switch for building the komodo daemon for this?  (hope that makes sense)

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: pardon the grammar, just had first sip of ‚òï

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
I think for running the KMD chain, the daemon does need sprout params as the KMD chain has sprout transactions on it
but for new assetchains created that have only sapling Z-txns, this will be useful

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Mylo Hush can build + sync without sprout params, because we have no sprout transactions in our chain

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Pirate can build and sync 32 blocks until it coredumps on the first JoinSplit, currently. But it's reasonable to relax some requirements about validating very old Sprout transactions, so Pirate should be able to do this, with a tiny bit more work than Hush

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gcharang i think the same trick that will work for Pirate will work with KMD, which does have sprout zaddr xtns in it's history

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: If a new AC has no sprout xtns on it, it can do exactly the same as Hush and avoid the dumb 900MB sprout files

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I synced a HUSH full node last night, from scratch, without ever having any Zcash param files on the computer, via the SilentDragon GUI. It downloaded all params needed (not sprout!!!) and did the diddly

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @dukeleto can the KMD daemon validate the sprout transactions without the sprout params?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: No, but also, validating old transactions that are behind checkpoints and DPoW isn't really providing a lot of security

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gcharang my idea is to make the daemon not download the sprout files, but if they are present, use them. This will allow dev/etc to do sproutly things if they need

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is a KMD/Pirate optimization

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: since Pirate needs to process sprout claims/etc in the future

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: "If we see a sprout xtn, only validate if we have sprout params on disk", something like that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and downloading sprout 900MB files become a manual thing, average nodes don't do

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: understood

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: thanks mate.  i'm tired.  i'll observe this new stream lined d/l stuff.  nice to remove sprout stuff.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c this looks like good news, librustzcash already has some things in the works that we want: https://twitter.com/str4d/status/1141680615781261312

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nice!

Author: TheTrunk#1040
Content:
Hey guys, Can you do some release notes and overall better komodo releases?
Like this https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/releases/tag/dev-multios-0.4.0a-alpha is pretty confusing. We (outside developers) are confused. Is it a stable release, ready for production, or still pre release, what are the changes, is it a fork, when is the fork activation etc...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: stable, exchanges and pools updated

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: fork activates july 15th

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: changes are mostly in the various CC modules, it is basically the annual update

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure how many commits or lines of code, it would be good for someone to indeed go through all the commits and list out the highlights

Author: TheTrunk#1040
Content: Great, Thank you... Good to hear that we have a release month before activation üòÉ

Author: TheTrunk#1040
Content: as some coins give just a few days/week.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, this was to give us time to make sure everything is smooth and still have time in case anything was not quite right. so far we only found some transient issues with a couple of the smaller assetchains.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, to my knowledge, for KMD itself it isnt actually hardforking as no consensus rules other than season 3 notaries changed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: however, if you run with season2 notaries, then your node is basically running without dPoW. it is a graceful degradation, still should work though not secured from 51% attack

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: please ask any specific questions, now i think about it, i think there were 100,000+ commits

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: vast majority isolated to specific CC, which wont be active unless those are in use

Author: TheTrunk#1040
Content: Also wanted to ask if there is some technical documentation on how to implement/ how exactly the over time 5% appreciation works - I mean how to implement reward claiming. I just know that I should basically look at every utxo for a given address, what locktime is there and calculate the amount it can claim and then try to send this new utxo with updated amount to my address. If there is some formula written for the amount, that would be helpful

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's easier

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @lukechilds made a repo with exactly that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TheTrunk just send all funds from an address to itself, with enough for a transaction fee

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that will claim interest via "negative fee"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://github.com/atomiclabs/get-komodo-rewards

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you will see a fee which is negative on block explorer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you are running the daemon, just add up the "interest" fields for all the vins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and that is the extra spending that the tx can do

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to calculate the value of the "interest" field, that get-komodo-rewards repo has all the gory details

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: very cool, i didn't know about that repo above

Author: TheTrunk#1040
Content: @dukeleto So supposing I have 1 utxo that originally has 100KMD and I just send 99.99KMD to the same address and 0.01 for fee, my address will actually receive lets say 101KMD? Like that simple?

Author: TheTrunk#1040
Content: Thank you for the repo, going through it üòÉ

Author: TheTrunk#1040
Content: oh thats nice simple repo

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TheTrunk basically, yes. Your receiving address will end up with more funds via a negative fee

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: let's say you had 5KMD interest on 100 KMD

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you would end up with 104.9999 KMD in the addr

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `fee - interest` becomes the actual "fee" once interest is taken into account

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: which is how it becomes negative

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: only utxos >= 10 KMD earn rewards and there are a few other rules

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and I consider Luke to know more about me than this topic üòÉ

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: If you're tryno implement in another language read my tests

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: https://github.com/atomiclabs/get-komodo-rewards/blob/master/test/unit.js

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: All consensus behaviour is described in there

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c i noticed that agama used to use a double fee (0.0002) for reward claiming, was that to ensure it gets into the next block, for rewards claims that were large in KB size?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no idea about agama fees

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: It used 0.0002 as a fee for rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe a gift to miners?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Not sure, but I wondered if it was to reduce the time somebody's entire balance is unconfirmed

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sometimes reward claiming could be large xtns that maybe some miners would not include in a block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that could be, but we dont have a feemarket yet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: not officially üòÖ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, true, not a fee market but big tx could easily go over the 0.0001 fee

Author: TheTrunk#1040
Content: Just an idea - would be good if insight explorer utxo api endpoint would return locktime of it too üòÑ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX is that something that is viable or available from the API at all? ^^^

Author: TheTrunk#1040
Content: It is available from the api, but you need to get the list of utxos and then for each of the transaction get the transactions information. So assuming 50 utxos it means 51 calls instead of just 1
